intro: Silene cucubalus f. lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as fields and dunes. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, and it is often found in disturbed or coastal areas. The species is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting pollinators.
